Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: (respond to me with @ so i get a notification please), could you use python to code a chain and smart contracts? or is python not supported?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Justaguy a linked library would be required to code contracts themselves in python, but you're able to code dapps in python on top of contracts. Here's an example of python dapp https://github.com/stakedchain/trollbox

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so to be clear, it is possible, just not yet

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: right, so if i wanted to code a platform with smart contracts right now, i should probably use c++ or java

Author: Alright#0419
Content: C and/or C++

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: gotcha

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: learning c++ right now to code a project, just wanted to check if i should go with a different language instead

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: thanks man! @Alright

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Justaguy the oracles contract itself has many many different use cases. You may be able to use it along with existing contracts to accomplish what you need

Author: Justaguy#6181
Content: ill check it out

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: @Smedley  I suggested the Agama wallet add a new feature to help track your addresses. A simple "name" column that can be edited, that is paired to the address.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Smedley right now it's possible to set a "username" on any assetchain via the KV feature. This could likely be used as a way of linking something human readable to a specific address

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Would actually be very simple to implement

Author: Smedley#8094
Content: Wouldn't you be able to have two of the same human readable addresses attached to two different addresses using KV?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Yes, hadn't really considered it. Could easily make it use the first set, but then that leads to problems of people using the same name unaware that someone is already using it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: believe it it would be best suited for a new contract, but a proof of concept would be viable right now with some dirty hacks
